pullRequest.body:
Refactor the definitions and proofs of IsUniform through the new `uniformMeasure`, which abstracts away from the need of a random variable and probability space.

A future PR can refactor the PMF parts in terms of a `uniformMeasure`.

This was #10141, which was split into a small PR to move the results (merged) and this one. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Looks good to me!
maintainer merge

bors r+

Thanks!
bors d+

Thanks!
bors d+

```suggestion
theorem isProbabilityMeasure {s : Set E} (hns : μ s ≠ 0) (hnt : μ s ≠ ∞) :
    IsProbabilityMeasure (uniformMeasure s μ) where
  measure_univ := by
    unfold uniformMeasure
    simp only [smul_toOuterMeasure, OuterMeasure.coe_smul, Pi.smul_apply, MeasurableSet.univ,
      restrict_apply, Set.univ_inter, smul_eq_mul]
    exact ENNReal.inv_mul_cancel hns hnt
```

```suggestion
    uniformMeasure (toMeasurable μ s) μ = uniformMeasure s μ := by
```

```suggestion
  map X ℙ = uniformMeasure s μ
```

```suggestion
lemma uniformMeasure.isUniform {s : Set E} : IsUniform (id : E → E) s (uniformMeasure s μ) μ := by
```
or perhaps better
```suggestion
lemma IsUniform.uniformMeasure {s : Set E} : IsUniform (id : E → E) s (uniformMeasure s μ) μ := by
```
which will work for `(.uniformMeasure)` notation
Having two definitions like this is a bad idea. You should keep the first one, and add a lemma saying it expands to `if x ∈ s then (μ s)⁻¹ else 0`
I've removed it, thank you!
Can you add a instance saying uniformMeasure is always a finite measure?

Added an instance for IsFiniteMeasure and IsProbabilityMeasure in the newest PR. I'd guess the later is more informative, so we might prefer to have that one, as the other one should be automatically inferable from that one? I'm not sure about this specific case though, as we have these two hypotheses?

Build fails, it can't unify the hypotheses {hns ...} and {hnt ...}. so I've removed the instances. What I tried was both of the following: 

```
instance uniformMeasure.isProbabilityMeasure {s : Set E} {hns : μ s ≠ 0} {hnt : μ s ≠ ∞} :
    IsProbabilityMeasure (uniformMeasure s μ) :=
  MeasureTheory.UniformMeasure.isProbabilityMeasure hns hnt

instance uniformMeasure.isFiniteMeasure {s : Set E} {hns : μ s ≠ 0} {hnt : μ s ≠ ∞} :
    IsFiniteMeasure (uniformMeasure s μ) := by
  apply uniformMeasure.isProbabilityMeasure.toIsFiniteMeasure
  exact hns
  exact hnt
```

You shouldn't need `{hns : μ s ≠ 0} {hnt : μ s ≠ ∞}` for showing it is a finite measure since it is the 0 measure in that case. As a result you can make the `isFiniteMeasure` a instance but not `isProbabilityMeasure`
fixed!

Actually, I think this is the same as [`ProbabilityTheory.cond`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Probability/ConditionalProbability.html#ProbabilityTheory.cond). Can you use it instead?
Good catch, let me change that indeed!
I've refactored the proofs, now `uniformMeasure` is unnecessary. I derived some useful results that seemed missing for `ProbabilityTheory.cond`, so I've renamed them and added them there!
If you need `@` every time you want to use uniformPDF, then you should probably change some implicit argument into an explicit argument.
The name does not seem to describe the result?
I'll make the necessary changes, do you want to take it off the queue?
"maintainer merge" asks for a final validation from a maintainer, it does not send the PR to bors right away: you can make the changes in this PR, and I'll merge it afterwards.
Great, I've made all the necessary changes I think!

```suggestion
 theorem cond_apply' {t : Set Ω} (hA : MeasurableSet t) : μ[t|s] = (μ s)⁻¹ * μ (s ∩ t) := by
```

I am not sure that works with volume_tac. If you write `uniformPDF s x` (without the measure), it might try to identify `s` with a measure. Can you test it, and put the measure at the end if it fails?
In defining `IsUniform` we are also doing ` by volume_tac`, that's why I put it here as well. Writing `uniformPDF s x` fails. Should I just remove `:= by volume_tac` here?
You should put the measure as last argument to make it work.
volume_tac doesn't seem to work, I've moved `μ` to the end.

Why did you remove volume_tac? What I meant is that moving the measure to the end would allow volume_tac to work. This should be perfectly fine: `def uniformPDF (s : Set E) (x : E) (μ : Measure E := by volume_tac)`

Also, if you remove volume_tac (which I think you should not do), there is no reason to move the measure to the end. On the contrary, it would then be better to have x at the end to be able to talk about the function E -> ENNReal.
I removed it, because I totally misinterpreted what you said, sorry about that. Thank you for elaborating! I will put the volume_tac back!

That dsimp is non-terminal:
```suggestion
  dsimp only [IsUniform, ProbabilityTheory.cond] at huX
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat : refactor `IsUniform` through uniformMeasure
